Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2010 07:00PM rcl4145 wrote: hi, bigwig           iam so very happy for you that is really good news. as far as something else turning up i agree with chrissyb we have breast's so it's a possibility, just make sure to go to your mamo's. take a deep breath and enjoy the rest of the summer. (((( hugs for you ))))))))) rcl4145
Posts.Title: Please help bigwig rcl4145

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2010 07:59AM rcl4145 wrote: hi, bigwig      after the ultrasound they say sometimes the MRI can come back with a false positive i hope this is what it i,. but again the waiting game is on. i don't know what the redness and pain could be for you maybe a infection, i never took any antidepresents before this, but i know i needed something, my pc perscribed me diazapam 5mg. it helped alot for the anziety. if you think this would help you don't be afraid to ask for some. i just called my doctor and he sent it to the pharmacy over the phone, i diden't even have to go see him. he gave me 7 pills and i still have 2 left so don't think you will get addicted to them.                  iam a school bus driver ( actually the little mini vans, i drive kids with problems to another town to a special school) so i was on vacation for the summer. so when my husband came home from work he would take me for long rides and i would not talk much just listen to the music on the radio, this helped me alot. he was my lifesaver during the 2 weeks of waiting.( his truck put on a lot of miles them 2 weeks)               we all know the waiting is the worst ever and i wish that you diden't have to go through this, but remember you are not alone, anytime your feeling bad just come on this web sight and talk, talking is good and one of the lady's will be here to talk or answer questions. i really don't know how i would have got through all this without them. i can't thank them enough. iam going to send you a ciber ((( hug ))) and when i went to church sunday i said a prayer for you and all the women going through this. rcl4145
Posts.Title: Please help bigwig rcl4145

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2010 10:32PM - edited Aug 20, 2010 10:35PM by rcl4145 hi, bigwig          i just went through the same experience as you are going through now. my mamo and ultrasound were done in april. then it was a biopsy which turned out to be ADH. them i had to see a surgon. then a MRI and a oncologist.i was so nervous and scarred when i had a appointment or when i was waiting for the results ( the worst was waiting for the phone to ring ) that i finally had to ask my pc for something to calm my nerves.            then i had to see another surgon, because i diden't care for my first one. ( she just blurted out you need a lumpectomy, i almost fell off the table i wasen't prepared for that.)  then she told me the same thing as you heard that this could be the tip of the iceburg, or it could be hiding cancer, and that ADH likes to hang around with cancer. the second surgon was very nice and answered all my questions. ( which i leared from this sight, it was a godsend that i found this sight and learned so much abou B.C. from all these wonderful lady's.)              finally my surgery was on july 1st. 2010. the surgery wasen't bad i had a local also, but i told my surgon that i diden't want to hear anything over the phone so i had a apointment on july 14th 2010.                I was very fortunate that mine was not B.C. and also that they diden't even find any ADH. they explained that it might have been removed when i had my biopsy. so it took 3 months for all this. but when they did my MRI they found something in my other breast and i had to have a ultrasound for that, but the ultrasound diden't pick up anything so i have to go for another MRI on september 16th 2010, then a mamo in october.              I too did not realize what women with B.C. go through especially all the waiting for test results and waiting for that dam phone to ring.                i wish the best for you on your results and i will pray that you get B9 results. rcl4145
Posts.Title: Please help bigwig rcl4145

Posts.Title: diagnosed with ADH what to do rcl4145 rcl4145

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 11:30AM - edited Jul 8, 2010 11:31AM by rcl4145 hi, the first time i went to the surgon she said you have atypical ductal hyperplasmia, i was like what!!!!! she said it again, i was like what is that, she said it could be hiding bc. i said could you write that down so i can look it up on the internet. she said you will get more confused, i said i can't get more confused because i don't know what that is. i came home and looked it up and found this wonderful wedsite. i found a new surgon and asked a lot of questions because i know now what i have. needless to say when i went to the oncologist he said that surgon was no longer with them she moved. iam glad i got a second opinion, i all so learned that from this sight. thanks to everybody on here rcl4145
Posts.Title: Beware of "Googleitis"... otter crazy4carrots

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2010 10:02PM rcl4145 wrote: hi, catwood  iam also hurting from the mamos, biopsy, mri, sometimes i drive myself crazy  thinking the worst. finally i had to ask the doctor for something ( i don't take pill's usually) but i really needed something to stop the shaking inside my body. it usually happened the day before my appointment or the day before when i thought the doctor was going to call with the results. my doctor put me on 5mg diazapan. i don't like the way they make me feel for the next couple day's but its worth it to stop the shaking inside me. i just called my GP and told the nurse that i needed something and the doctor called it in to the pharmacy. he did have to see me  but he must have known that women sometimes need something to get throught this torture. i do have to admit i still worry alot about the upcoming excesional biopsy and iam scarred of the results, but iam not freaking out as much ( i diden't even take a diazapen today before my appointment with the surgon) i think you get to the point of o.k find out what this is and go on from there.you just want to know. after waiting for over 2 months ( from my mamo and ultrasound core needle, biopsy, mri and now excesional biopsy( which probalby won't be for a couple weeks then the results for that in 7-10 day's)  and i still don't know if i have cancer or not. the only reason i think that iam not as scared as i was is this sight. i thank god for finding all they's beautiful women that have put there story's up hear for us all to LEARN from ( i don't learn anything from the doctors ) to get HOPE from and most important of all is knowing that your not alone. 2 months ago i diden't know anything and today when i saw the surgon i knew what questions to ask ( you would have thought i was the doctor lol ) no matter what my outcome is i will always come back to this sight to help with infomation to other women who will be just as terriffied as we are now. good-luck on friday, i believe in the power of prayer. i will say a extra special prayer for you tonight that all goes well your friend rcl4145
Posts.Title: STILL WAITING AND PARALYZED catwood Chevfan

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2010 02:48PM - edited Jul 2, 2010 02:49PM by rcl4145 hi, catwood iam so happy for your B-9 results with the mets. for  the rest of the results you have to fight this invasion of bc. and become a survivor ( you can do this ) good thoughts and prayers are with you always. i went for my lumpectomy today, it went good, but after i was so depressed and scared to death of the results ( that i won't get till i see the surgon on july 14th.) so long for results allways why why why. your friend rcl4145

Posts.Title: when to do MRI after ALH diagnosis? nouly leaf

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 05:51PM rcl4145 wrote: hi, i was diagnosed with ADH i saw 2 sergons a oncologist and my pc doctor and they all said take it out now because it could be hiding BC so i went for my lumpectomy on july 1st. i have a appointment with the surgon on july 14th for my results. durring all this they sent me for a MRI and it picked something up in my other breast. i was sent for a ultrasound but the ultrasound coulden't pick it up,  so its another MRI for me in 3 months. i have been going through this sense april 8th and i still don't know if i have BC, iam affraid that this is going to be my new life and iam scarred. so i don't really now when you say enough is enough. rcl4145
Posts.Title: when to do MRI after ALH diagnosis? nouly leaf
